aboutArchitecture.title: About the Architecture
aboutArchitecture.description: Understand the structural principles behind LexOrbital's modular design system.

modules.title: Modules
modules.description: Schematic representation of LexOrbital's modular architecture. Each module represents a distinct functional layer with specific responsibilities and interfaces.

a.name: Module A — Interface Layer
a.role: Functional role: User interaction and display orchestration
a.details: Handles all visual presentation logic, component rendering, and user input processing. Manages the interface state and delegates data operations to lower-level modules.

b.name: Module B — Data Structure
b.role: Functional role: Information architecture and organization
b.details: Defines the structural schema for all data entities. Ensures consistency across modules through standardized data models and type definitions.

c.name: Module C — Logic Engine
c.role: Functional role: Business rules and computational operations
c.details: Implements core algorithmic logic, validation rules, and computational transformations. Operates independently of interface concerns.

d.name: Module D — State Management
d.details: Maintains global application state, manages state transitions, and ensures data consistency across module boundaries.

e.name: Module E — Documentation System
e.role: Functional role: Technical and user documentation
e.details: Provides structured access to technical specifications, user guides, and architectural documentation. Self-documenting through metadata.

f.name: Module F — Legal Framework
f.role: Functional role: Compliance and regulatory structure
f.details: Manages legal documents, accessibility standards, ethical guidelines, and regulatory compliance requirements.
